definition: (modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]

sentences.english: His mom would stop him every time he made noise while eating.
sentences.chinese: 吃饭时，他一吧唧嘴，妈妈就说他。

sentences.english: He always squeezes toothpaste in the middle of the tube and makes a big noise when eating.
sentences.chinese: 他总是从中间开始挤牙膏，而且吃饭的时候吧唧嘴。

sentences.english: You are still reading this even though it's so stupid.
sentences.chinese: 你还在继续读这篇傻了吧唧的文章。

sentences.english: It would probably be a little chewy , but I don't think it would taste so bad.
sentences.chinese: 可能有点软了吧唧的，但是我想味道不会太差吧。

sentences.english: His sodden trousers were clinging to his shins and his shoes squelched.
sentences.chinese: 他湿透的裤子紧贴小腿，鞋子吧唧作响。

sentences.english: Of a very fat, striped , orange child.
sentences.chinese: 养着一个，肥了吧唧，浑身条纹，橙色的孩子。

sentences.english: The 38kind is when people are starving, I don't eat with his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 善良就是别人挨饿时，我吃肉不吧唧嘴。

sentences.english: Don't fall on the food like a pig, snorting and smacking your lips.
sentences.chinese: 不要趴在食物上吃得像一头猪一样哼哼，还吧唧嘴巴。

definition: (onom.) patter, splatter, click/to smack one's lips/to pull (on a pipe)
to sip/to smack one's lips/to taste/to savor
to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
to draw back the corners of one's mouth
denote a sound or sharp noise (gunfire etc)
to protrude/to stick out/to pout (also written 噘)/to embarrass (people)
(interjection of surprise, pain, annoyance etc)/Oh my!/Uh-oh!/Ah!/Ouch!
